title: Services
subject: Angular
theory: Services are classes with a specific purpose. They are responsible for business logic, data fetching, and state management. They help keep components lean and focused only on the view.

examples.explanation: The @Injectable decorator marks it as a service that can be injected.

common_mistakes.correction: Always use Dependency Injection. Never use 'new'.

interview_questions.question: Why do we use services?
interview_questions.answer: Code reuse, separation of concerns (business logic vs view logic), and sharing state between components.

real_world_use_cases.description: A service that handles all HTTP calls to a backend API.

exam_notes: Singletons by default if providedIn: root.
summary: Services are the backbone of Angular application logic and data management.
